com.nmaltais.calcdialog

Class CalcDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • android.app.DialogFragment
        • com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class CalcDialog
extends android.app.DialogFragment
    Dialog with calculator for entering and calculating a number

      CalcDialog setClearDisplayOnOperation(boolean clear)
      Set whether to clear display when an operation button is pressed (+, -, * and /) If not, display will be cleared on next button press Default is not clearing
      CalcDialog setFormatChars(char decimalSep, char groupSep)
      Set character for formatting number Use FORMAT_CHAR_DEFAULT to use device locale's default character By default, formatting will use locale's characters
      CalcDialog setGroupingSize(int groupingSize)
      Set the size of groups separated by group separators 3 does 000,000,000 4 does 0,0000,0000 Default size is 3
      CalcDialog setMaxDigits(int intPart, int fracPart)
      Set max digits that can be entered on the calculator Use MAX_DIGITS_UNLIMITED for no limit
      CalcDialog setMaxValue(java.math.BigDecimal maxValue)
      Set maximum value that can be calculated If maximum value is exceeded, an "Out of bounds" error will be shown.
      CalcDialog setRoundingMode(int roundingMode)
      Set calculator's rounding mode Default rounding mode is BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP Ex: 5.5 = 6, 5.49 = 5, -5.5 = -6, 2.5 = 3
      CalcDialog setShowZeroWhenNoValue(boolean show)
      Set whether zero should be displayed when no value has been entered or just display nothing
      CalcDialog setSignCanBeChanged(boolean canBeChanged, int sign)
      Set whether sign can be changed or not By default, sign can be changed
      CalcDialog setStripTrailingZeroes(boolean strip)
      Set whether to strip zeroes from the result or not By default, zeroes are stripped.
      CalcDialog setValue(java.math.BigDecimal value)
      Set initial value to show By default, initial value is null.

      • setValue

        public CalcDialog setValue(java.math.BigDecimal value)
        Set initial value to show By default, initial value is null. That means value is 0 but if setShowZeroWhenNoValue(boolean) is set to true, no value will be shown.
        Parameters:
        value - Initial value to display. Setting null will result in 0

      • setMaxValue

        public CalcDialog setMaxValue(java.math.BigDecimal maxValue)
        Set maximum value that can be calculated If maximum value is exceeded, an "Out of bounds" error will be shown. Maximum value is effective both for positive and negative values. Default maximum is 10,000,000,000 (1e+10)
        Parameters:
        maxValue - Maximum value, use null for no maximum

      • setMaxDigits

        public CalcDialog setMaxDigits(int intPart,
                               int fracPart)
        Set max digits that can be entered on the calculator Use MAX_DIGITS_UNLIMITED for no limit
        Parameters:
        intPart - Max digits for the integer part
        fracPart - Max digits for the fractional part. A value of 0 means the value can't have a fractional part

      • setRoundingMode

        public CalcDialog setRoundingMode(int roundingMode)
        Set calculator's rounding mode Default rounding mode is BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP Ex: 5.5 = 6, 5.49 = 5, -5.5 = -6, 2.5 = 3
        Parameters:
        roundingMode - one of BigDecimal.ROUND_*

      • setStripTrailingZeroes

        public CalcDialog setStripTrailingZeroes(boolean strip)
        Set whether to strip zeroes from the result or not By default, zeroes are stripped. Strip, 12.340000 = 12.34 No strip, 12.340000 = 12.340000
        Parameters:
        strip - whether to strip them or not

      • setSignCanBeChanged

        public CalcDialog setSignCanBeChanged(boolean canBeChanged,
                                      int sign)
        Set whether sign can be changed or not By default, sign can be changed
        Parameters:
        canBeChanged - whether sign can be changed or not if true, dialog can't be confirmed with a value of wrong sign and an error will be shown
        sign - if canBeChanged is true, sign to force, -1 or 1 otherwise use any value

      • setFormatChars

        public CalcDialog setFormatChars(char decimalSep,
                                 char groupSep)
        Set character for formatting number Use FORMAT_CHAR_DEFAULT to use device locale's default character By default, formatting will use locale's characters
        Parameters:
        decimalSep - decimal separator
        groupSep - grouping separator, use FORMAT_CHAR_NONE for no grouping

      • setClearDisplayOnOperation

        public CalcDialog setClearDisplayOnOperation(boolean clear)
        Set whether to clear display when an operation button is pressed (+, -, * and /) If not, display will be cleared on next button press Default is not clearing
        Parameters:
        clear - whether to clear it or not

      • setShowZeroWhenNoValue

        public CalcDialog setShowZeroWhenNoValue(boolean show)
        Set whether zero should be displayed when no value has been entered or just display nothing
        Parameters:
        show - whether to show it or not

      • setGroupingSize

        public CalcDialog setGroupingSize(int groupingSize)
        Set the size of groups separated by group separators 3 does 000,000,000 4 does 0,0000,0000 Default size is 3
        Parameters:
        groupingSize - grouping size, use 0 for no grouping
